description.narrative: 1. Improved education system that promotes equity, inclusiveness and effective learning 2. Citizens are informed, organized and engage in critical problem solving, monitoring governance and provision of quality education 3. Government and stakeholders are responsive and accountable in providing inclusive and quality education

HHakiElimu har ansökt om finansiering från för deras strategi avseende 2017-2021. HakiElimus budget för hela strategiperioden $34 MUSD (313 MSEK).
Huvudmålet för strategin är att realisera ”ett öppet, rättssäkert och demokratiskt samhälla med god kvalitet i utbildningarna för alla”. För uppnå detta eftersöker HakiElimu resultat i tre områden som även är programfokus. i Barn är i skolan och lär sig aktivt. ii. Medborgare är informerade, självsäkra och aktivt engagerade. iii. Regeringen är öppen, ger respons och är ansvarsskyldig.
Sverige avser endast att finansiera HakiElimu tills den nuvarande svenska resultatstrategin för Tanzania går ut 2019. Finansieringen gäller implementeringen av HakiElimus strategi för perioden 2017-2019, även om beredningen har bas i HakiElimus långsikta mål och vision.
HakiElimus totala budget för strategin uppgår till 313 771 000 SEK. Sverige kommer att bidra med 30 000 000 SEK för hela perioden och beloppet motsvarar 5 % av HakiElimus ambitiösa femårs budget.
Organsationer och givare som redan beslutat om att finansiera HakiElimu är: Kanada 648 900 USD, Nederländernas utrikesdepartement har åtagit sig att finansiera 214 000 USD, Comic Relief bidrar med 238 400 USD och Stone Foundation har bundit 200 000 USD. Totalt kommer 2 262 555 USD från andra givare och utgör 6 % av den totala budgeten för strategiperioden. Med Sveriges bidrag inkluderat så utgör givarmedel 3 849 555 USD, vilket är 11 % av budgeten för hela strategiperioden. Sverige ser HakiElimus utmaningar gällande kapitalanskaffning. Dock anser Sverige att risken för underfinansiering är låg. Detta baseras på den tidigare relationen mellan HakiElimu och givare då HakiElimu historiskt sett inte haft några större svårigheter med att samla in kapital.
HakiElimu has applied for Sida for funding for its strategic plan for 2017-2021. The overal budget total for the whole strategy period is USD 34,011,170 million equivalent to 313,771,000 SEK
The overall goal for the current Strategy is to realize “an open, just and democratic society with quality education for all”. To contribute to this goal, HakiElimu has been working and will continue working to realise the following three outcomes as the programmatic focus of the organisation during this period:
i. Children are in schools and actively learning. ii. Citizens are informed, confident and actively engaged iii. Government is open, responsive and accountable
Given the fact that Sweden strategy to Tanzania is valid up to 2019, Sweden will only fund HakiElimu based on the same strategy timeframe. Even if HakiElimu has been assessed based on its broad targets and achievements covering 2017 - 2021, Sweden will only support implemntation for 2017 - 2019 implemntation period.
The intervention’s total budget is 313,771,000 SEK, out of which Sweden will only contribute 30 000 000 SEK equivalent to 1,078,793 USD which is 5% of the total HakiElimu's ambitious budget for five years.
Other organizations that have made commitments already include, Canada USD 648 900, Netherland Ministry of Foreign Affairs has committed USD 214 000, USD 238 400 from Comic Relief, and Stone Foundation which has committed USD 200 000. This makes the total contribution from other donors USD 2 262 555, which is 6% of the ambitious budget for HakiElimu 2017 - 2021 strategy. When assessing total budget commitment in relation to HakiElimu's strategic period in question, HakiElimu has secured a total of 3,849,555 USD which is 11% of the total budget for HakiElimu for five years. Sweden recognizes the challenges HakiElimu is facing when it comes to fundraising. However, based on its past strategy performance and the relationship it has with bilateral donors, There is possibility for HakiElimu to secure the required funds.

HakiElimu has applied for Sida for funding for its strategic plan during the period of 2017-2019. The overall budget total for the whole strategy period is USD 34,174,000 equivalent to 313,771,000 SEK
The overall goal for the current strategy is to realize “an open, just and democratic society with quality education for all”. To contribute to this goal, HakiElimu has been working and will continue working to realise the following three outcomes as the programmatic focus of the organisation during this period:
i. Children are in schools and actively learning. ii. Citizens are informed, confident and actively engaged iii. Government is open, responsive and accountable
Given the fact that Sweden strategy to Tanzania is valid up to 2019, Sweden will only fund HakiElimu based on the same strategy timeframe. Even if HakiElimu has been assessed based on its broad targets and achievements covering 2017 - 2021, Sweden will only support implemntation for 2017 - 2019 period.
The intervention’s total budget is SEK 313,771,000 out of which Sweden will contribute SEK 30 000 000 equivalent to USD1,078,793 which is 5% of the total HakiElimu's ambitious budget for five years.
Other organizations that have made commitments already include, Canada USD 648 900, Netherland Ministry of Foreign Affairs has committed USD 214 000, USD 238 400 from Comic Relief, and Stone Foundation which has committed USD 200 000. This makes the total contribution from other donors USD 2 262 555, which is 6% of the ambitious budget for HakiElimu 2017 - 2021 strategy. When assessing total budget commitment in relation to HakiElimu's strategic period in question, HakiElimu has secured a total of 3,849,555 USD which is 11% of the total budget for HakiElimu for five years. Sweden recognizes the challenges HakiElimu is facing when it comes to fundraising. However, based on its past strategy performance and the relationship it has with bilateral donors, there is possibility for HakiElimu to secure the required funds

tag.narrative: 4.1 - By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes.
4.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla flickor och pojkar fullbordar avgiftsfri och likvärdig grundskole- och gymnasieutbildning av god kvalitet som leder till relevanta och ändamålsenliga kunskaper.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

description.narrative: Hakielimu activity period with Embassy of Sweden had ended in 2019 with an ambition to exit smoothly and explore other future potential partners. Coming to 2020, Canada approached Embassy of Sweden for a matching grant for them to be able to sign a new agreement with Hakielimu amounting to 4m USD for a period of four years. Given Hakielimu needs for the fund in 2020, the good collaboration between embassy of Sweden and Canadian High Commision and the idea to ensure a meaningful and responsible exit, Sweden agreed to support Hakielimu with 5000 000 SEK as final disbursement before exit. Below are activities which were implemented during the exit period year 2020. Outcome 1. An improved education system that promotes equity, inclusive and effective learning. HakiElimu 2020 annual report mentions about its 2017 report which assessed the impact of the Education and Training Policy (ETP) with a ‘fee free’ education, which identified further gaps in the ETP, for example, the policy focussed more on enrolment than providing sufficient plans to strengthen the education system. According to Hakielimu, this publication coupled with multiple social media campaign resulted in to government annoucement in 2019 to launch a national plan to review the ETP of 2014. It is also reported that, in 2020 Hakielimu published evidence to indicate imbalances in allocation of school capaitation grants. It seems based on that, the government has agreed to revise the capitation grant computation formula. The 2020 report says that Hakielimu will continue to advocate for the implementation of the new computation formula whose implementation has been delayed, and Hakielimu will also track the disbursement to ensure it takes into account the needs of all marginalised and vulnerable groups. Outcome 2. Citizens are informed, organised and engage in critical problem solving, monitoring governance, and provision of quality education. The 2020 HakiElimu’s annual report shows that school level interventions have contributed to improved attendance and reduced dropout of both girls and boys. This improvement is associated with dialogue established between parents, teachers and Hakielimu have led to improved attendance rates of between 52% to 65% across the 10 pilot intervention schools. Hakielimu 2020 report also indicates that, the implementation of the Girls Retention and Transition Innitiative (GRTI), has also strengthened girls’ agency and participation and increased parental support for girls’ education, as a result, girl’s attendance rates increased from 75% in 2018 to an average of 85% in 2020. It is also reported that, Since 2019 HakiElimu identified 1,764 girls who were at risk. Through engagement with parents and school heads HakiElimu were able to prevent 1,490 girls from dropping out of school. These activities have also contributed to improved learning outcomes for girls. In the programme implementation schools, the number of girls who passed Form Four examination has increased by 1.1% from 67.1% in 2018 to 68.2% in 2020. Outcome 3. Government and stakeholders are responsive and accountable to provide inclusive and quality education. To strengthen accountability, HakiElimu reports that it has organised training and dialogues with Local Government Authorities and school committee members to help them understand their roles and responsibilities in policy and budget implementation and to promote transparency, accountability, and anti-corruption. It is reported that in 2020, at least 57% of programme implementation villages are publicly displaying information on income and expenditure through notice boards and in public meeting as required by law in Tanzania. Outcome 4. Organisational capacity for effective programme implementation strengthened. HakiElimu conducted 3 quarterly reflection meeting which took stock of progress in programme implementation. One of the key issues discussed was the best option of using technology to improve learning in programme schools and strengthen the Friends of Education Movement. As a result of this meeting, HakiElimu mapped different platforms and systems that can be rollout to programme schools to improve access to books, promote in-service training of teachers as a way of improving teaching, and facilitate routine interaction and reporting of Friends of Education activities It is reported that HakiElimu has recruited five new employees in 2020, namely Programme Officer-Gender and VAC, Programme Officer-Print Media, Quality Assurance Coordinator, Grants and Compliance Officer and Education Techinical Advisor. Unexpected result is related to COVID - 19 impact in annual activities implementation. More activities were delayed due to that and it is assumed that pupils in schools might have retarded a bit on learning ability due to execution of school closure measures.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
